features.title: Creates Virtual Private Clouds
features.description: Creates a VPC-based topology based on two VPCs, by default.

features.title: Configures subnets
features.description: Defines multiple subnets in the VPC to define IP ranges and organize resources within the network.

features.title: Creates a transit gateway
features.description: The transit gateway connects the two default VPCs that the deployable architecture creates.

features.title: Integrates Flow Logs and Activity tracking
features.description: IBM Cloud Object Storage is used for Flow Logs and Activity Tracker, which enhance the observability and auditing of your infrastructure.

features.title: Supports edge networking
features.description: Isolates and speeds traffic to the public internet by using an edge VPC in a specific location, if enabled.

flavors.label: Standard
flavors.name: standard

features.title: Reduces failure events by using multizone regions
Collects and stores Internet Protocol (IP) traffic information with Activity Tracker and Flow Logs
Securely connects to multiple networks with a site-to-site virtual private network
Simplifies risk management and demonstrates regulatory compliance with Financial Services
Uses an edge VPC for secure access through the public internet
Uses Floating IP address for access through the public internet

diagrams.description: The Standard variation of the VPC landing zone deployable architecture deploys a simple Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) infrastructure without any compute resources. You can use this architecture as a base on which to deploy compute resources. The Standard variation uses two Virtual Private Clouds (VPC) - a Management VPC and a Workload VPC - to manage the environment and the deployed workload. Each VPC is a multi-zoned, multi-subnet implementation that keeps your workloads secure. A transit gateway connects the VPCs to each other and Virtual Private Endpoints are used connect to IBM Cloud services.

configuration.description: Region where VPC will be created. To find your VPC region, use `ibmcloud is regions` command to find available regions.
Optionally, you can bring you own Hyper Protect Crypto Service instance for key management. If you would like to use that instance, add the name here. Otherwise, leave as null
If you're using Hyper Protect Crypto services in a resource group other than `Default`, provide the name here.
Create an edge VPC. This VPC will be dynamically added to the list of VPCs in `var.vpcs`. Conflicts with `create_f5_network_on_management_vpc` to prevent overlapping subnet CIDR blocks.
Number of zones to create teleport VSI on Management VPC if not using F5. If you are using F5, ignore this value.
Set up bastion on management VPC. This value conflicts with `add_edge_vpc` to prevent overlapping subnet CIDR blocks.
Provision teleport VSI in `bastion` subnet tier of F5 network if able.
Bastion type if provisioning bastion. Can be `full-tunnel`, `waf`, or `vpn-and-waf`.

Public SSH Key. Must be an RSA key with a key size of either 2048 bits or 4096 bits (recommended) - See https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/vpc?topic=vpc-ssh-keys. If key already exists in the deployment region, it will be used and no new key will be created. Use only if provisioning F5 or Bastion Host.

Image name for f5 deployments. Must be null or one of `f5-bigip-15-1-5-1-0-0-14-all-1slot`,`f5-bigip-15-1-5-1-0-0-14-ltm-1slot`, `f5-bigip-16-1-2-2-0-0-28-ltm-1slot`,`f5-bigip-16-1-2-2-0-0-28-all-1slot`,`f5-bigip-16-1-3-2-0-0-4-ltm-1slot`,`f5-bigip-16-1-3-2-0-0-4-all-1slot`,`f5-bigip-17-0-0-1-0-0-4-ltm-1slot`,`f5-bigip-17-0-0-1-0-0-4-all-1slot`].
F5 vsi instance profile. Use the IBM Cloud CLI command `ibmcloud is instance-profiles` to see available image profiles.

A unique identifier for resources. Must begin with a lowercase letter and end with a lowercase letter or number. This prefix will be prepended to any resources provisioned by this template. Prefixes must be 16 or fewer characters.

Whether to create a service-to-service authorization between block storage and the key management service.

List of VPCs to create. The first VPC in this list will always be considered the `management` VPC, and will be where the VPN Gateway is connected. VPCs names can only be a maximum of 16 characters and can only contain lowercase letters, numbers, and - characters. VPC names must begin with a lowercase letter and end with a lowercase letter or number.
